conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows labeled A, B, C, and D change in position and size when the light source moves to the back-right.

The image shows four objects: a screwdriver (A), a cake (B), a medical roll (C), and a ring (D), each casting shadows towards the back-right due to the current light source position at the front-left.
The light source is currently at the front-left, casting shadows towards the back-right.
When the light source moves to the back-right, the direction of the shadows will reverse.
Shadows will move towards the front-left due to the new light source position.
Shadows will generally become longer as the angle between the light source and the objects increases.
The shadow of A (screwdriver) will shift towards the front-left and possibly elongate.
The shadow of B (cake) will move towards the front-left and potentially become longer.
The shadow of C (medical roll) will shift towards the front-left and may extend.
The shadow of D (ring) will move towards the front-left and could elongate depending on the angle.
When the light source moves to the back-right, the shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift towards the front-left and are likely to become longer due to the increased angle of illumination.
